```{python}
#| label: fig-fb-8
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "Effect of negative feedback on non-linearity"
import schemdraw as sd
import schemdraw.elements as elm
import schemdraw.dsp as dsp
with sd.Drawing() as d:
    d.config(unit=2)
    d.config(fontsize=16)
    
    elm.Dot(open=True).label('$v_{in}$')
    elm.Line().right().label('$_+$',loc='rgt',ofst=[-0.5,-0.1])
    sm = dsp.SumSigma()
    dsp.Arrow().right().label(r'$v_\epsilon$').length(2)
    dsp.Box(w=6,h=1.5).label(r'$a_1 \cdot v_\epsilon + a_2 \cdot v_\epsilon^2 + a_3 \cdot v_\epsilon^3$',mathfont='dejavuserif')
    elm.Line().right()
    elm.Dot()
    d.push()  # Save this drawing position/direction for later
    elm.Line().right()
    D = elm.Dot(open=True).label('$v_{out}$')
    d.pop()   # Return to the pushed position/direction
    elm.Line().down().length(d.unit*1.5)
    dsp.Arrow().left().length(3)
    dsp.Box(w=4, h=1).label('$b$')
    elm.Line().tox(sm.S).label('$v_f$')
    elm.Line().up().length(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Arrow().toy(sm.S).label('$_-$', loc='bottom', ofst=[0.7,0])
    elm.Gap().right().at(D.end)
    elm.Label(r'$\Longleftrightarrow$',fontsize=40)
    elm.Gap().right()
    elm.Dot(open=True)
    elm.Label().label(r'$v_{in}$',loc='top')
    elm.Line().right().length(1)
    dsp.Box(w=7,h=1.5).label(r'$A_1 \cdot v_{in} + A_2 \cdot v_{in}^2 + A_3 \cdot v_{in}^3 + ...$')
    elm.Line().right().length(1)
    elm.Dot(open=True)
    elm.Label().label(r'$v_{out}$',loc='top')
```
